name: unseating
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
unseat
unseat verb [T]
(POLITICIAN)
to remove someone from power, especially as a result of an election: The opposition candidate failed by only 39 votes to unseat the cabinet minister.

unseat verb [T]
(RIDER)
If a horse unseats its rider, it throws them from its back.
